question: ingress
answer: Kubernetes Continuous Integration and Delivery 2023 Before we create Services - There are several ways to get access to the cluster from the inside - Ingress (later on) - NodePort (now) - Let’s create K3D with NodePort exposed - destroy old one - k3d cluster delete kube3 - create new one - k3d cluster create kube4 -p "30001:30001@agent:0" -s 1 -a 1 - Creates port mapping to the worker and inside - https://k3d.io/v5.4.9/usage/exposing_services/?h=nodeport#2-via-nodeport 13

question: services
answer: Kubernetes Continuous Integration and Delivery 2023 Services - Pods get updated, destroyed or just plain fail - Pods are immutable - New Pods will be created in their place - That means new IP - Pod DNS is tied to the unique Pod name - who would keep a list of running Pods? Not us - Enter Services - stable IP - stable DNS - stable ports 2
